main event: A strange glowing object was observed in the sky over Anadarko, Oklahoma on April 1, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as a circular shape with a pink center and light blue outside, glowing like a star.
The object was observed moving slowly from the northeast to the northwest quadrant of the sky, then faded out after about 2 minutes.
The object was observed both visually and through a telescope.
The sighting was reported to military authorities, including the Airdrome Officer at Tinker AFB.
The investigation concluded the object was a 'probable balloon', but no further details are provided.
sighted object: circular object with pink center and light blue outside, glowing like a star
